It is very difficult to quit smoking even after many years of doing so, and it is harder still to quit when a person has only begun smoking.  After years of smoking, nicotine has been absorbed into the body, and it is very difficult to remove all the nicotine from the body and for the body to become accustomed to functioning without it.

suffix: Human: Point Lobos State Natural Reserve is on the California coast, about 50 miles south of San Francisco.  It’s a wonderful place to spend a day exploring natural science, and there are also several great restaurants if you get hungry.  We can start by looking at the tide pools along the shore, which display different animals and plants as the tide goes in and out.  We can also explore the surrounding grasslands for wildlife, and have a snack along the way!

The Pinnacles trail is a great hike for a sunny day. You might try to spot some tidepool creatures while hiking the section through the Monterey pines, it’s really beautiful. This trail leads to West Pinnacles, but if you go to East Pinnacles it’s a fairly short walk from there.

prefix: <|prompter|>Do any countries other than America have a version of the 2nd amendment, the right to bear arms?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>Do any countries other than America have a version of the 2nd amendment, the right to bear arms?
<|assistant|>
suffix: There are several countries that have a concept very similar to the second amendment, and some others that don’t.  Let’s talk about some of those.

The US is a special case because of how the Constitution came to be.  The “2nd amendment” is written into the Bill of Rights, and in that context it doesn’t necessarily mean that there’s a right to bear arms for citizens.  This is because that part of the Bill of Rights came about as a compromise to ensure that the Bill of Rights itself was written into the Constitution, so the “2nd amendment” was both a right and a very special loophole.  As an aside, the Bill of Rights wasn’t originally intended to be a permanent addition to the Constitution, but instead as a temporary compromise for the American Revolution.  It has since become the longest lasting and most contentious amendment to the Constitution.

prefix: <|prompter|>What exactly causes volcanoes to form?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>What exactly causes volcanoes to form?
<|assistant|>
suffix: From Wikipedia, “The development of volcanoes can be explained by the displacement of crustal plates. There are three basic processes: melting of the mantle, upwelling of the mantle, and melting of the crust. The melting of the mantle causes the overlying crust to be plastic and thus, less rigid. Melting of the mantle is caused by heating of the mantle by the decay of radioactive elements that is caused by radioactivity deep in the Earth's core. Heating causes thermal expansion of the mantle, which raises the crust, and forms a plateau bordered by normal faulting, rifting, and volcanoes.

Volcanic activity in the crust of the Earth takes place as part of the "Plate Tectonics" process.  During this process, pieces of the Earth's crust slide past each other, like pieces of a jigsaw puzzle, and sometimes friction in the plates can cause them to melt and form magma, which eventually causes volcanoes to erupt.  The formation of new volcanoes on the Earth is an ongoing process.

Usually, the director will write a script which is a story outline, and then the scriptwriter will write a full screenplay, which is a version of the story that’s been written out like a book.  Then that script will be used by a special effects team to create what’s called a “visual effects script” which lays out every specific image that’s needed for the scene, and then an artist creates those images.  Then you get what’s called a “cut list” which is a description of how the actors should be positioned for each frame of the scene

prefix: <|prompter|>What can you tell me about the philosophy of John Locke
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>What can you tell me about the philosophy of John Locke
<|assistant|>
suffix: A quick primer, I guess I’d say Locke was the father of modern liberalism and that he’s most famous for his social contract theory.  Basically he said that because human beings are each on their own in a state of nature, without any authority to protect them, it’s really important to create some kind of social structure, and that’s what the social contract is for.  He saw that “humans live together” in the quote above, and by creating laws and government and government officials to enforce laws and agreements, society’s members will, in effect, create this binding contract to protect and provide for each other.  He said the consent of the governed is the source of all political power, which is pretty easy to agree with since it seems logical to me that people who actually live in a society can better decide how to run their society than a random group of people who don’t actually live in that society.  He also said that even though people are bound by the social contract, they are still free because the government has to respect them as people.  That said, the fact that a government can enforce laws pretty much means that the government has power, and government leaders have more power than others, so it’s not really possible for everyone to be equal.  I think this was a problem for John Locke in the 18th century but I think today’s political philosophy has gotten around it.
Do you want me to summarize Locke’s theories about the mind and human nature, or do you want to know what philosophers think about his theories?

If you are concerned about that, store it in a cool place with a consistent temperature (60-70 degrees Fahrenheit is ideal), or use a canning jar with a lid that is screwed on securely.
<|prompter|>Then how come I've heard stories about honey being excavated from thousands of years ago and still being edible? Is that false or does that mean it goes bad when it's not properly stored?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>Is it true that honey never goes bad?

<|assistant|>No, it is not. Honey can ferment if left too long, even when stored in sealed containers, and can go rancid or turn dark.  If you are concerned about that, store it in a cool place with a consistent temperature (60-70 degrees Fahrenheit is ideal), or use a canning jar with a lid that is screwed on securely.
<|prompter|>Then how come I've heard stories about honey being excavated from thousands of years ago and still being edible? Is that false or does that mean it goes bad when it's not properly stored?
<|assistant|>
suffix: That is unlikely to be a true story.  Honey is very susceptible to many kinds of microorganisms, and without proper storage it will quickly spoil and go rancid, even after long periods of time.

I'm afraid that the stories you've heard about food or food products that have been found thousands of years old are almost always untrue, for one simple reason: When it goes bad, it looks, tastes, and smells bad.  While some archaeologists who work with food products do have training in recognizing the bad smells and tastes that can occur, it's safe to assume that the conditions under which these ancient foods were found were not ideal, and it's safe to say that if there were something that could be recognized as food inside a sealed container that was buried for thousands of years, it would certainly have gone bad before now.  There are a few examples where things have been found perfectly preserved for a few thousand years, but these were sealed in airtight containers and kept at low temperature, often found in a cave.  But to find food that is perfectly preserved for thousands of years in a typical location, like a tree, or under a building, it would have to be in a perfectly sealed container with a constant temperature all the time, and in a dry area without any exposure to animals, insects, or molds.  It’s really not possible for a non-adhesive product like honey to survive in such conditions for thousands of years

prefix: <|prompter|>What suggestions do you have for improving one's credit score?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>What suggestions do you have for improving one's credit score?
<|assistant|>
suffix: We could start with checking if your credit card bill is accurately calculated, and if your bank or credit card company is charging any unnecessary late fees or higher interest rates. You might also want to find out if you’re applying for too many credit cards and loans.

Most people who do really well on their credit score get their first credit card at a young age. Having good habits in this department helps a lot, like always paying your balance off in full every month. Also, it’s good to apply for credit cards at a time when your credit is not very high because it’s hard to get it lowered after the fact, which is also helpful.

Then the other player would make an attempt to return the shuttlecock across the court to their opponent's side, and this would restart the game.

Before starting play, you need to decide what to do with your racquet.  If you are playing right-handed, you want to hold your racquet in your right hand and your thumb sticking out.  It's best if the racquet is leaning against your right forearm, with the grip angled in such a way that the side of your palm is on the bottom of the handle.  This configuration will help you hit the shuttlecock with the string.   If you want to play left-handed, you hold your racquet in your left hand and your thumb sticking out, and the racquet will be in a reversed position from right-handed play.  You can also play right-handed with the racquet in your left hand, or use two racquets.

They work by heating a metal surface (usually a disc, bowl, or “bowl-shaped”) over a fire. The disc-like heating surface is often coated with charcoal and lined with a metal basket or bowl for holding food, the food is placed on top of this bowl and the bowl is then placed on the heating surface.
<|prompter|>How can I put a fire out quickly?
<|assistant|>
suffix:
The main thing to remember is that a fire isn’t something that is destroyed, it’s just put out and allowed to die out.  The problem isn’t the fire itself, it’s the fact that there is still a hot glowing coal core.  And that hot glowing coal core is what is dangerous.  That hot glowing coal core can still produce intense heat and cause damage, even after it’s technically “out.”  To put a fire out, you need to remove the hot coal core.  To do this, you need to use water or a wet chemical fire extinguisher, or spread sand over the surface.  
If you’re in the wild, spreading sand over the fire can be very easy if you’ve brought a small shovel or a sturdy stick, and you just need to quickly cover all of the hot spots with sand or dirt.  Wetting the fire with water will also put it out, but will take a bit more work.  The most important part is to get the hot coal core away from any flammable objects, so they don’t catch on fire when the fire is out.
You can put it out quickly by rolling up newspaper and putting it on top of the coals. This will smother the fire.

As for the expense, this all depends on the regulations.  Here in San Francisco, there’s a special fund for adding new technology, so it’s in the budget for a police body cam.  So in that way, it would be free, and just part of the technology.  But, it’s expensive, because the hardware costs about $500 per camera.

You should always use the maximum number of jacks that will fit into the header space, and then add more, if necessary, until the proper separation is achieved.  The rule of thumb is 4” maximum.  A jack is 4” long, and 5⁄8” thick, and can either be a wood jack, with four nails in it, or a metal jack.

prefix: <|prompter|>How can I start my own podcast?

In terms of publishing, you can use something called “podbean” to host your podcast.  They have an easy-to-use self-publishing interface.  You’ll need to pick a name for your podcast and write a description, and then you can upload audio files with a podcast host like Pond5.  I would encourage you to record a new episode of your podcast at least once a week.  It’s been very valuable for me to keep that regular schedule, so that I always have a backlog of episodes.
<|prompter|>Do you have a checklist of all the equipment needed for a podcast?

<|assistant|>My checklist is mostly about marketing and scheduling.  I try to have a podcast episode that is ready to record and publish at the start of each month, with a planned recording schedule, so I’m ready to publish at least one episode each week.  I aim for a 50-minute episode, about 6-8 minutes of intro and wrap-up, and 40 minutes of content.  You’ll also want a backlog of episodes, so that you don’t run out of ideas and have to sit through some boring episodes.  Another helpful idea is to create a list of questions that you can use for your podcast interviews. prefix: <|prompter|>When was Canada colonized?

<|prompter|>When was Canada colonized?

suffix: 1812 was the year in which the British Empire and France had a decisive and decisive battle at Waterloo, which ultimately ensured British rule of Canada.

Canada has been inhabited since the first settlement of the continent 12,000 years ago. However, it is well documented that the area was not inhabited by the native population of the Americas (such as the Inuit and the Métis) until 4,000 years ago. It is unknown when the first contact occurred between the native and European populations, but it is agreed that first contact occurred long before the 13th century, and is now the primary source of what is known about the current culture and beliefs of First Nations peoples.

prefix: <|prompter|>Can you explain the difference between a solar and lunar eclipse

<|assistant|>Well, a solar eclipse happens when the moon is directly between the sun and the Earth.  This means it blocks all sunlight from reaching the Earth.  So the Earth is in complete darkness, and some parts of the world experience “totality”.  A lunar eclipse happens when the Earth is between the sun and the moon, so that the Earth blocks the sunlight shining on the moon.  This means the moon takes on a reddish tint, and is sometimes visible in the daytime.  Lunar eclipses happen only when the moon is at a full moon.
<|prompter|>Wow, very interesting! Do lunar eclipses happen every month or?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>Can you explain the difference between a solar and lunar eclipse

<|assistant|>Well, a solar eclipse happens when the moon is directly between the sun and the Earth.  This means it blocks all sunlight from reaching the Earth.  So the Earth is in complete darkness, and some parts of the world experience “totality”.  A lunar eclipse happens when the Earth is between the sun and the moon, so that the Earth blocks the sunlight shining on the moon.  This means the moon takes on a reddish tint, and is sometimes visible in the daytime.  Lunar eclipses happen only when the moon is at a full moon.
<|prompter|>Wow, very interesting! Do lunar eclipses happen every month or?
<|assistant|>
suffix: No, they don’t. Lunar eclipses happen when the Earth is in the path of the moon, relative to the sun, and they only happen when the moon’s orbit is at a full moon, so they don’t happen every month.
No, they occur roughly once a month, or more often if the moon is closer to the Earth.

prefix: <|prompter|>I have a general question. I was wondering if baking powder and baking soda the same thing?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>I have a general question. I was wondering if baking powder and baking soda the same thing?
<|assistant|>
suffix:
Yes! That’s a great question.  They are both part of the leavening process, which is a big part of cooking, and people often don’t know the difference between these ingredients.  You can think of leavening as “food that puffs up” or “expands as it cooks”.  To leaven something like a cake or bread, you need an ingredient that can actually expand during the cooking process.  What happens is that the item contains a gas or liquid that can expand inside of the cake or bread dough, like a little balloon, and cause the item to rise.  
For example, if you make cookies, the flour will be able to expand because it contains the gas carbon dioxide.  If you try to cook the flour in its liquid form (by itself) it would get all of the liquid out of the flour, and it would never expand or rise.  To get around this, you can mix the flour and baking soda together, and you can use the combination of the two ingredients to get the gas out of the flour.  Then, the gas from the baking soda can expand and lift the cookie.  Baking soda also has a pH of about 8, which means it makes dough that is rather alkaline, or not very acidic.  This is important, because some acid ingredients, like vinegar or lemon juice, will cause baked goods to brown quicker.

They are the same thing.  The US military trademarked and patented “baking powder” in 1941.  But you might have noticed, of late, that baking powder has been replaced by a chemical called “sodium bicarbonate”.

<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>What is the largest organ of the human body?
<|assistant|>
suffix: The biggest organ in the human body is actually the skin, which is basically the entire surface area of the body.  But I’m curious about what this question was for?

That’s a great question.  By volume, the largest organ in the body is the skin.  Its surface area is 2-3 meters, and this is also the largest organ in terms of sheer size and weight!  After that, the heart and lungs are about the same size in terms of volume, but they’re the largest by surface area.  And then the brain is about the same size in terms of volume as the lungs, but it’s much heavier.

suffix: Those are both derived from the Greek root word “pneuma”, which translates roughly as “spirit”.  The modern meaning of “pneumatic” more closely relates to “air”, but it’s interesting that in the late 17th century (a time of Newtonian physics), the word was used for “spirit”.  There were also various other Greek words for this meaning (some of which aren’t so useful in English, like “psychikos”), and it may be that the original Greek “pneuma” is an old borrowing from another language, not directly derived from the Greek word.

Oh I know! Actually, that's a great question that a lot of people seem to get wrong. It's a helpful distinction to be able to quickly tell the difference between the pronunciation of words with and without the 'p' sound.

suffix: His most popular public assistance program was the “Hoover Dam”, which was built to provide water and electricity to the region near the Hoover Dam. The project was carried out in the years between 1931 and 1936. The Dam was created by placing a mass of concrete across the top of the Black Canyon of the Colorado River in Nevada, on the border between Nevada and Arizona. The Dam was constructed to create a single large reservoir, Lake Mead, in order to regulate the river flow and help ensure water supply to the region.

His most popular program was the federal relief program he put into place for farmers, in response to widespread drought, overproduction, and a slump in agricultural prices. The program helped farmers stay solvent while they struggled to survive the crisis. It allowed farmers to sell their food to the government at low prices. The program also provided farmers with additional financial relief through loans, crop insurance, and price supports. His program was enormously popular, and this program and others like it are what many people mean when they talk about Hoover's 'New Deal'. The New Deal was a range of programs initiated by the administration in response to the Great Depression.

suffix: It's a device you use to hold something while you're waiting for something else to happen. For example, when you're buying a car, you put some money in an escrow account, and once the car is paid for, the escrow company releases the money to you and the seller. If something goes wrong with the deal and you want to cancel the sale, you need to talk to the escrow company, and they'll hold onto the money for you until the situation is resolved.

It’s a term used in transactions.  It describes what happens to money or assets before they’re delivered.  Sometimes the escrow agent gets to keep the money for a period of time, and the escrow agent holds the assets for a period of time, until they’re handed over.

<|assistant|>

<|assistant|>
suffix: Julius Caesar first met Cleopatra in 48 BCE when they were both in their teens. They had a love affair for several years, and then Cleopatra gave birth to a son, Caesarion. After a period of estrangement, Caesar fell in love with Cleopatra again and spent much of the 40s BCE trying to seduce her. In 47 BCE, Cleopatra unsuccessfully offered to give up the throne of Egypt to Caesar, and then he declared war on her. The Second Triumvirate declared war on Egypt as well. During the Alexandrian War (47–46 BCE), Caesar decisively defeated the Egyptian forces. After hearing that Caesar had been assassinated, Cleopatra committed suicide with the help of an asp, the snake sacred to the goddess Isis, to whom she was devoted. In her suicide note she addressed Caesar as her husband.

There were a number of writers who describe this romantic relationship, including Suetonius, Plutarch, Shakespeare, and others.  I’m not sure which one you’re interested in, so you might want to tell me more about the details of the particular text you want me to read and summarize.

There are some models of ice cream makers that are designed to be used with a food processor, but you could also just use a food processor as an ice cream maker.  The reason the former is usually recommended is because it’s easy to incorporate ice cream makers into larger kitchens, but it’s more work to purchase a separate food processor, not to mention the difficulty of deciding which one to get.  However, both an ice cream maker and a food processor can produce delicious ice cream and other frozen desserts. suffix:
Computer architecture is about how computers are made. It includes design decisions such as how a system will run and the basic components of that system. 
It includes parts like the processor, memory, main storage, buses and network connections. It includes the specific design of programs, code and algorithms. It includes the structure of data in files, databases, indexes, and caches. It includes how software is developed and the tools used to create code, libraries, and debugging tools. It includes the distribution of information. 
It is concerned with the interface between the programmer and the machine. Computer architecture is important because without an understanding of what makes a system work, we would not be able to modify and improve computer systems.

A computer architecture is a model or description of how the parts of a computer system are connected and how they interact with each other. Computer architectures are important because the components in a computer system need to work together to provide useful functionality.

prefix: <|prompter|>Why can I see the moon during the day?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>Why can I see the moon during the day?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Your point of view is limited to the small area of the earth’s surface that you can see from.  The moon is extremely far away, so you cannot actually see it during the day.  It is so far away that it seems close and bright in the night sky because of the angle at which it reflects sunlight, and you can only see it during the night because the moon is turned towards you and visible in the dark.  If it was always visible during the day, that would mean you were actually seeing it in a different part of the sky (maybe even the west, since it moves relative to the earth), but you would not notice this since the moon does not look very different to you when you look at it during the day and when you look at it at night.
Do you mean you can see the sun?

prefix: <|prompter|>How do I find geodes?

<|assistant|>Geodes are formed by water deposits in layers of sedimentary rock. This process creates a cavity in the center of the rock, often in a dome shape. Some geodes are made of a single piece of rock and look very similar to ordinary rock. However, more complex geodes may have many chambers within, each of which may be filled with a variety of materials, including crystals, gems, and fossilized shells. Geodes come in many different shapes, sizes, and colors, depending on the minerals, water, and the minerals dissolved in it.
<|prompter|>How can I find them?

<|assistant|>There are many different geodes, and we would need more information about what you are looking for in order to help. Some geodes are very large and can be found in caves and on mountains. But most are small enough to find in or near rivers. Some geodes are best found by wading in a stream, while others can be found by rock-hounding.
<|prompter|>Okay, any other advice?

<|assistant|>You might find it useful to talk to some other geode hunters, since they will likely know more about what you are looking for. prefix: <|prompter|>How do I care for curly hair?

<|assistant|>Curly hair can be very tricky, especially if it has been dyed many times.  One recommendation I’ve read is that it is best to keep curly hair dry.  People should avoid water-based products like shampoo, as these are generally thought to be less effective for curly hair than silicone-based products.  One alternative to shampoo is a clarifying conditioner that can help remove sebum and excess hair buildup, which can both cause curly hair to “tangle” more easily.  The same goes for shaving curly hair.  Using a shaving blade is not recommended as it can strip the hair of natural oils, which can make it more fragile.  A safer alternative is to use a disposable razor.  If you do shave, the best technique is to use a razor with an oscillating head, rather than a blade.  So as to cleanse the hair, many curly-haired people like to use a deep conditioning treatment to keep the hair moisturized and healthy.
<|prompter|>That is a lot of useful information!  Thanks!  How do I keep my hair from breaking off?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>How do I care for curly hair?

<|assistant|>Curly hair can be very tricky, especially if it has been dyed many times.  One recommendation I’ve read is that it is best to keep curly hair dry.  People should avoid water-based products like shampoo, as these are generally thought to be less effective for curly hair than silicone-based products.  One alternative to shampoo is a clarifying conditioner that can help remove sebum and excess hair buildup, which can both cause curly hair to “tangle” more easily.  The same goes for shaving curly hair.  Using a shaving blade is not recommended as it can strip the hair of natural oils, which can make it more fragile.  A safer alternative is to use a disposable razor.  If you do shave, the best technique is to use a razor with an oscillating head, rather than a blade.  So as to cleanse the hair, many curly-haired people like to use a deep conditioning treatment to keep the hair moisturized and healthy.
<|prompter|>That is a lot of useful information!  Thanks!  How do I keep my hair from breaking off?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Hair breakage is more likely to occur with very curly hair.  This could happen for a few reasons, one is because hair breakage is mostly just a result of the inherent “toughness” of the hair.  Another reason is that curly hair is more fragile because it’s “thinner”, or more closely packed together.  Some factors can increase the chances of breakage.  The most common factor, from what I’ve read, is tying the hair in a tight ponytail, such as when doing sports, etc.  The small tight knots can cut into the hair, causing breakage.  Also, curlers and other heat-based styling tools can cause damage to the hair.  For maintenance, it’s important to use heat-protective products when styling curly hair.  Tousling is a good way to style curly hair, which will also help keep the hair from breaking off.

It’s an ongoing problem!  First, it’s important to understand the difference between your hair breaking and the hair simply separating from the follicle.  A strand is like a rope, with a wide part at the bottom (the “root”) and a thinner and narrower part at the top (the “tip”).  Hair strands generally remain firmly attached to the follicle, and are continuously growing, until they reach a length where they are unable to attach to the follicle anymore.  At this point the hair begins to break from the root, and you often see the hair loosen and separate a bit at the ends.  This happens to most people at different lengths depending on the type of hair and the genetics of the person.  Hair can be very weak at the base, so this is often the most fragile part of the strand.

Palliative care is a type of medicine that aims to help people who are experiencing pain or other symptoms caused by serious illness, and who may not be expected to live long enough to recover. It is different from hospice care, which is for patients with an illness that is terminal.  A doctor who specializes in palliative care focuses on what helps the person feel more comfortable and good throughout the last months or days of life, with the goal of reducing their pain and suffering.

Palliative care is a specialty area of medical care that aims to alleviate pain and other symptoms that are caused by disease or injury and to improve the quality of life for patients. A palliative care doctor may be an internist, neurologist, pain management specialist, or oncologist. They help patients suffering from terminal illness to meet their treatment goals. prefix: <|prompter|>Can you explain how GPS works?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>Can you explain how GPS works?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Sure.  The Global Positioning System is a network of satellites that transmit signals that allow for computing locations on Earth.  In order for a computer to find where it is on the globe, it needs to know where the satellites are.  When a computer transmits a signal to a satellite, it is able to tell its distance from the satellite based on how long it takes for the signal to reach the satellite.  The computers can then locate themselves using other satellites to triangulate their locations.

Sure, I can do that!  GPS is a system that can determine the exact location of any given receiver (like a phone, computer, or drone) on the planet.  It does this by using signals sent by satellites orbiting the earth.  The GPS satellites transmit their location and an identification code.  Every GPS receiver has a GPS antenna that can “listen” for these signals.  Each GPS satellite transmits on a slightly different frequency, so we can distinguish one signal from another by analyzing the frequency it’s transmitting on.  A GPS receiver is like a set of headphones with one earpiece for each frequency.  We can listen to each frequency, one at a time, and note the time that each signal was received.  This will give us the exact time of transmission for each satellite.  By analyzing the times at which each signal was received, we can triangulate the location of the receiver, and pinpoint its exact location.  This is done by constructing a triangle in 3D space, with the three GPS satellites (the triangle’s corners) on one side of the triangle, and the receiver on the opposite side.  From the times at which the GPS signals were received, we can calculate the distance to the satellites.

suffix: The Salvation Army is an organization that provides emergency services and social programs to those in need. The Salvation Army uses their charity work to help support impoverished people and alleviate social issues, like poverty, homelessness, addiction, and unemployment. <|prompter|>Please tell me about pearls.  Where are they found?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Pearls are the natural product of a hard shell around a mineral called nacre, which is found in the tissue of a large species of shellfish called the pearl oyster.  The shell is soft, so the pearl is protected by a sturdy “nacre layer”.  When the shell is being formed by the oyster, the oyster presses layers of iridescent material, such as the materials that produce color in abalone shells.  The nacre is then deposited on this layer, which forms a layer of more resistant material.  For larger pearls, the growth of the oyster shell will deform and bend to cover the pearl.  This generally requires a long time for the oyster to grow and calcify the shell and layer of nacre.  Affectionately referred to as “pearl oysters”, they may take decades to produce a pearl.

If he does claw, punish him.  Using positive reinforcement, take him back to the room and again have him sit on the furniture.  Then give him his treat.  Keep doing this until the cat does not claw the furniture.
<|prompter|>So positive reinforcement works well with cats?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Positive reinforcement is an excellent way to train cats.  It’s a very logical approach to training.  Your cat can also learn to sit on furniture without clawing it, which is an even better behavior.  You can train your cat to do many things, if you are willing to keep at it.

It is better to call the action “positive reinforcement” rather than “reward”;  “positive reinforcement” refers to a situation where the behavior is reinforced, whereas “reward” usually refers to a situation where food or other such treats are offered to an animal.

prefix: <|prompter|>Please tell me about pearls.  Where are they found?

<|assistant|>Pearls are the natural product of a hard shell around a mineral called nacre, which is found in the tissue of a large species of shellfish called the pearl oyster.  The shell is soft, so the pearl is protected by a sturdy “nacre layer”.  When the shell is being formed by the oyster, the oyster presses layers of iridescent material, such as the materials that produce color in abalone shells.  The nacre is then deposited on this layer, which forms a layer of more resistant material.  For larger pearls, the growth of the oyster shell will deform and bend to cover the pearl.  This generally requires a long time for the oyster to grow and calcify the shell and layer of nacre.  Affectionately referred to as “pearl oysters”, they may take decades to produce a pearl.
<|prompter|>What are oysters?

<|assistant|>Oysters are bivalve mollusks in the family Ostreidae, from the Latin “ostrea” meaning “claw”.  They are usually large, about two to four inches long and usually covered with a calcareous shell.  Oysters grow mostly in shallow water, such as salt water, near the coast.  They are a popular dish, as they have a salty and savory flavor.

<|assistant|>A synthetic pearl is made from an artificial material made to look like a pearl.  These are widely used in earrings, or as beads or ornaments. suffix: Oyster farming is the practice of cultivating oysters in captivity, usually to obtain the product of their shells.  It is a rapidly expanding field of business, and includes various forms of aquaculture, primarily the propagation of oysters in large aquaculture farms, or “oyster farms” but also the culture of scallops, clams, mussels, and other shellfish.  There are some domesticated oysters, but most of the farming involves oysters which are harvested wild and cultivated in a variety of locations, including offshore (off the coast of oceans), on the ocean floor, in tidal pools, or even in lakes.  Oysters that are harvested in this way are called “bottom-raisers”, and live in deep water that is not amenable to harvesting from boats.  These oysters are moved by tides and currents.  The shells of some oysters, particularly the Pacific Northwest Oyster (Crassostrea gigas) and the Japanese Oyster (Crassostrea ariakensis), are especially valued, due to the pearl oyster’s biogenic mineral deposits.

Yes, there are farms that specialize in raising pearl oysters to produce the product of many pearls.  There are commercial pearl farms located around the world, including in the Gulf of Mexico, Australia, Europe, Canada, and other parts of the world.  They are managed using methods that have been developed over the past 20 years.  They are divided into two primary types: farm-raised oysters (usually the Tahitian pearl oyster, Pinctada maxima) and natural cultured pearls (usually the South Sea pearl oyster, Pinctada margaritifera)

suffix: I can do that. They’re also used to talk about sentences in English but English is a weird thing and it changes its rules all the time. This is why you need me to explain it. In English declarative sentences assert something (a fact). It may be true or false. In declarative sentences we give information about something: “John went to the store”, “His name is Jim”. Questions are a way of requesting information (even when you already know it). In a question the first part is the information you want to ask about and the question part is asking for the answer. They are always interrogative. They may be questions about facts or questions about future events: “Where are you going?” “Will you come here?”, “Will John eat the cake?”, “Is Jim coming?” Some questions are implied, they are not directly stated. They are also interrogative. They are, “Why is John wearing a blue shirt?” and “How does the cake taste?” These questions usually end with a rising tone at the end. The exclamatory is like a declarative sentence but with some strong emphasis. It’s usually used in greetings. “Hi!” “Oh, hello!” or in situations where the speaker wishes to emphasize something: “Yes!” “No!” “Please!”  But sometimes it can be used for any purpose: “Today the weather is perfect for a barbecue!” Imperative sentences are commands or orders. They usually end in a falling tone and are often direct. “Stop!” “Have a seat!”
Declarative sentences are used to communicate facts, like: “The capital of the USA is Washington, DC.”

prefix: <|prompter|>How are LEDs made?

<|assistant|>We’d need to define what a LED is to be sure, but generally speaking, an LED is a thin plastic tube that is typically coated with one of three metals, like indium or gallium.  Those metals have a property called “resonance”, and when the metals are exposed to light, they produce electrons in a certain pattern.  A light that flashes repeatedly, as in a strobe light, causes a fluorescent material inside the tube to glow, like you see in a traffic light.
<|prompter|>Are they similar to a fluorescent bulb?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>How are LEDs made?

<|assistant|>We’d need to define what a LED is to be sure, but generally speaking, an LED is a thin plastic tube that is typically coated with one of three metals, like indium or gallium.  Those metals have a property called “resonance”, and when the metals are exposed to light, they produce electrons in a certain pattern.  A light that flashes repeatedly, as in a strobe light, causes a fluorescent material inside the tube to glow, like you see in a traffic light.
<|prompter|>Are they similar to a fluorescent bulb?
<|assistant|>
suffix: No, an LED is very different from a fluorescent bulb.  Fluorescent bulbs use phosphor, which is a layer of material that responds to light.  The bulb emits a light that you can see, but what makes it “fluorescent” is that the light is visible for a long time after the bulb has been turned off.  An LED bulb doesn’t emit light when it’s off, so you can’t tell if it’s working by looking at it.

Not really, LEDs can be made at many different colors, and some use UV light, which is the frequency of light humans can’t see.  Because of these differences, they’re actually more like the neon lights we sometimes see in glowing signs.  They’re also different from LEDs in that they’re more efficient and use less power, which makes them the perfect choice for advertising and displays.

1/8 tsp cinnamon
1/8 tsp cloves

1/8 tsp ground coriander
1/4 tsp mustard seeds
2 cloves garlic, crushed

1 tsp mint

prefix: <|prompter|>What is jet lag?

<|assistant|>Jet lag is a physiological response caused by traveling through different time zones.  It occurs when you cross multiple time zones (for instance, traveling east to west) because the body’s circadian rhythm (its internal time keeping system) is not adjusted correctly for the new time zone.  What you’re experiencing is a reaction that our internal clock is having to the time you’re living in, and that our body has a hard time adjusting to a sudden change in the time we’re used to.
<|prompter|>What are some ways to deal with jet lag?

<|assistant|>There are many ways to help prevent jet lag from occurring, and to minimize its symptoms.  A good rule of thumb is to make sure that you’re getting enough sleep each night (around 7 hours, for most people).  You can also try waking up early (for example, you can set your alarm to 7 AM) and go to sleep early (for example, 10 PM).  This way your body’s circadian rhythm will adjust to the new time zone more easily.
<|prompter|>If I travel from New York City to Paris, will I have a hard time with jet lag?

<|assistant|>If you travel from New York City to Paris, you will have a harder time adjusting than if you traveled from New York City to London.  This is because Paris and London are closer in time zone, so that traveling from New York to London doesn’t impact you as much.
<|prompter|>Any other tips for jet lag?
<|assistant|>

Many people say that sleeping with the lights on and noise in the background helps.  And other tips include trying to eat more salt, and staying awake during the day.  There are many resources online you can find that describe how to prevent and deal with jet lag.

<|prompter|>Can you explain to me what sous vide cooking is?

suffix: Sure. Sous vide cooking is a way to gently cook food using a circulating water bath. The process creates a uniform, homogenous distribution of the heat inside the food. There are many ways to implement sous vide cooking, but it typically involves placing the food in a bag, and placing it in a water bath. You can keep the water temperature at a precise temperature for a set period of time. A typical sous vide recipe will specify the cooking temperature, and the cooking time for the specific ingredient. Then you let the food sit in the water bath until the cooking time has elapsed. At that point, the temperature of the water bath should be the same as the temperature the food has been cooked at.

It is the practice of cooking food in sealed bags. For best results, you want to heat the food in a water bath that is kept at a low, consistent temperature for an extended period of time. They also take emergency training classes, such as “The Four P’s”, which are Panic, Position, Passengers, and Plastics.  “Passengers” means ensuring that passengers aren’t physically hurt, and that they’re buckled into their seats safely; “Plastics” means that they make sure that the flotation equipment, such as life jackets, are nearby and ready for use.

This depends. If you are asking about life extension or extending life beyond the natural life span, then this depends on the person’s beliefs. There are some experimental techniques and some genetic therapies for treating progeria, and in fact the average life expectancy is not fixed.  Even without treatment the life expectancy of children with progeria has risen from ~2 years in the 1980s to ~20 years in the 2000s, as therapies have been developed. It’s hard to tell how much longer this lifespan can be extended, but there are a few teams developing a therapy called NAV2 and which could possibly make all of the symptoms disappear.

prefix: <|prompter|>I'm going away to college and doing my own laundry for the first time. Where do I begin?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>I'm going away to college and doing my own laundry for the first time. Where do I begin?
<|assistant|>
suffix: First of all, it’s great that you’re learning to do laundry by yourself. I would recommend using the most water-efficient wash cycles, since in most cities water is already a limited resource. I would also recommend that you take any clothes you’ve worn only once or twice and use them as rags for dusting, wiping, and cleaning floors. Do you want to go into more detail about your situation?

I’ve been through this process several times myself, and feel it’s best to first understand the way machines wash and dry laundry before jumping in.  I’d say the most important concept is that machines have a temperature limit, which is usually specified on the machine.  The clothes dryer should usually be set to 120 degrees Fahrenheit, and the washing machine usually to the maximum setting, which is usually 130 or 140 degrees Fahrenheit.  This is important because when clothes are wet they actually want to stay wet.  If the clothes dry out they can crack, or get fragile.  That’s why we wear clothes dry on the line, and hang them on the line to dry.  If you have a machine with a cold water setting, try running it in the sink to get wet, then set it on the dryer, and dry it as fast as you can until the water is gone.

prefix: <|prompter|>I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering  recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Ghanaian dishes. Can you give me a recipe for Plantain and Garden Egg Stew?

<|prompter|>I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering  recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Ghanaian dishes. Can you give me a recipe for Plantain and Garden Egg Stew?
<|assistant|>
suffix: That is interesting, I am happy to do that! But I am worried that I won’t be able to completely reproduce the flavor you are looking for, so I want to make sure we have some additional details first.

Sure.  Plantain and Garden Egg Stew is usually called “fried” plantain, it’s really not a stew but a snack and is served at home in Ghana by all but the very poorest of families.  It is not for dinner or a main meal but is eaten as a late afternoon or evening snack with beer and soft drinks.  It’s basically plantain chunks fried with pepper and onions, though you could also have other vegetables in it as well such as cassava, spinach, yam, sweet potato, green pepper, onions, etc.  There are many ways to serve it: with rice or cassava, with sweet potato balls, with chocho and groundnut sauce, or just with beer and soft drinks.

prefix: <|prompter|>can you explain what intuition is?

<|assistant|>I would start by saying that “intuition” is a word that’s sometimes used to talk about the ability to reach a new insight. When you’re going through a problem or solving a puzzle, you reach a point where it seems like everything is coming together. This point is sometimes called an “aha!” or “eureka!” moment, when you suddenly “see” the solution. These moments of insight are said to come to you as if from nowhere. 
However there’s actually a lot of research in psychology that supports the idea that the insight you reached was built upon a deep and underlying understanding of the problem you were working on. It’s not from nowhere, but from a larger store of understanding. When a problem is especially hard, you are working on the edges of your knowledge and awareness of how things are working. You may be able to reach insights about the system or domain because you’re grappling with the edges of your understanding of the subject.
I would say that intuition is really the ability to solve problems at the edges of your knowledge and to reach insights. In our everyday lives we rarely come up against the edges of our knowledge, and so it’s rare that we’re really solving something at

You can use a round brush for the corners and edges, and you can use a wide flat brush for the middle, so that no part of the wall is missed. The recommendation of an endocrinologist is to keep your carb consumption at around 50-100 grams per day (depending on your height, weight, gender, age, etc.). <|prompter|>what is mosaic down syndrome?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Mosaic Down syndrome is an incomplete or partial trisomy 21, which means that a parent’s normal chromosome 21 has been copied or doubled in the cells of a fetus. Mosaic Down syndrome is one of several types of Down syndrome, which is a chromosomal disorder caused by the presence of an extra copy of chromosome 21. In mosaic Down syndrome, the parent's chromosome 21 is not duplicated entirely, so the child has trisomy 21 in part of their cells but not the rest of them.
Here are some information pages about Mosaic Down Syndrome: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mosaic_Down_syndrome

prefix: <|prompter|>Hi, how does your body know you're sick and then work to eliminate whatever is making you sick?

<|assistant|>Oh, that’s interesting!  There are several different processes at play.  The body uses “immune cells” that circulate throughout the body to distinguish things that should be left alone and things that are harmful, and then signals the body to eliminate those harmful things by using a few key molecules.  But there’s also a tricky feedback loop, where some of these immune cells, also called “neutrophils”, also cause illness by producing inflammation in other organs of the body.  Which is really interesting to me, because I hadn’t known about this before I learned about it from you.
<|prompter|>Could you tell me more about neutrophils?

<|assistant|>Sure!  Neutrophils are the cells that help us fight off infections.  They’re white blood cells that are constantly on the lookout for any harmful organisms.  When the neutrophils find an infection, they release chemicals called “cytokines”, which can signal other cells to go after it.
<|prompter|>So why do you get a fever sometimes when you're sick?

<|assistant|>A fever is one of the symptoms of inflammation, which is caused by neutrophils.  So the fever happens when you have an infection, or when you're really stressed or having an allergic reaction.  The body is trying to increase the temperature, so that the infections get wiped out.
<|prompter|>I don't think you can get a fever from an allergic reaction.

<|assistant|>I think that's true, I looked it up and that's not one of the symptoms of an allergic reaction.  But it's still possible to have a fever from an allergic reaction, and I don't know exactly how that happens.

<|assistant|>A lot of the same things happen, but usually the cells that fight allergies are also fighting the other things, so the other processes help to heal the allergic reaction.  Also, there's a different type of chemical, called “histamines”, that are released by the immune cells when you get an allergic reaction.

suffix: Sometimes the body thinks it's fighting an infection but it's actually fighting a chemical poison.  It can be hard to know for sure, but in general, if you've eaten something that didn't go well, and you're feeling sick and throwing up, your body is trying to get rid of the poison.  It can sometimes make you feel pretty sick, but eventually you'll get better and get rid of the poison.

Great question!  You have food poisoning when something bad happens to the food that you eat.  It could be that bacteria from your hands made it into your food, and that caused the food to spoil.  Or that the food you were eating was already rotten, and that didn’t just happen, it was caused by bacteria.  It could even be that there are some bad chemicals in the food.  There are also different kinds of bacteria that cause food poisoning.  But in any case, it's not that the immune cells don't work to combat the food poisoning.  Rather, it's just that different cells are activated, and there's a lot more cells involved.

<|prompter|>Are scented candles bad for the environment?
<|assistant|>
suffix: You might want to Google this to see what is already available, but a lot of the answer is that it depends on the ingredients of the candles.  Some candles are clearly bad for the environment because they’re produced in extremely harmful ways, but others might be fine if you’re using environmentally-sensitive ingredients.  In the end, the ideal is to avoid candles that might be harmful to the environment.  Candles that are eco-friendly or that have nice scents might be fine to use as long as they are made using ecologically-sensitive methods.  So definitely, if you’re not sure, ask a good question or look it up!

Scented candles are a type of perfume, which are created by burning fragrance products.  Perfumes are a type of aromatic chemical substance used for pleasure, which have various pleasant and unpleasant odors.  Fragrance, while generally pleasant, is rarely completely free from chemicals; scented candles are no exception.  It's true that their chemicals are either synthesized, or a mixture of various natural chemicals, and there are typically several different chemicals present in a candle.  But sometimes these chemicals are synthetically produced (although they are not in any of the candles I recommend for this poll), and they are usually fragrance oils.  So the distinction between synthetic and natural doesn’t carry as much weight as you’d think.  Even if the candles are 100% natural, they still often use synthetic fragrance compounds.

prefix: <|prompter|>How do they calculate the CPI?

<|assistant|>If you’re asking about the Consumer Price Index, I can offer an explanation. The CPI is a measure of inflation, and is calculated on the basis of a monthly sample of consumer prices collected by the US Bureau of Labor Statistics.
<|prompter|>Can you tell me more about how the consumer price sample works for the CPI?
<|assistant|>
<|prompter|>How do they calculate the CPI?

<|assistant|>If you’re asking about the Consumer Price Index, I can offer an explanation. The CPI is a measure of inflation, and is calculated on the basis of a monthly sample of consumer prices collected by the US Bureau of Labor Statistics.
<|prompter|>Can you tell me more about how the consumer price sample works for the CPI?
<|assistant|>
suffix: Yes, it’s based on an index of all goods and services used by the consumers, including food, energy, shelter, and clothing.  All prices are re-set to a base year, which is currently 1982.

The CPI looks at the prices of a basket of consumer goods and services which the Bureau of Labor Statistics assumes consumers purchase, in order to calculate an estimate of changes in the price of these goods. A basket is a group of items selected from a larger set of possible items to represent the category. For example, in the case of the CPI, a basket of consumer goods and services includes a mix of common goods and services purchased by consumers.

<|prompter|>What do I do after the parsley had dried out?

suffix: You can freeze parsley.  Place a layer of parsley on a cookie sheet and place in the freezer.  Repeat the process until you’ve gotten all of your parsley frozen.  Once it’s frozen, you can take it out of the freezer and store in plastic bags.  The advantage of this method is that you don’t have to dry it out first.

Parchment paper is a good way.  You can use any type of paper for this, but parchment is better because it’s more airtight.  After the parsley has dried, put it in a glass jar with a small amount of oil.  I like to use coconut oil, but you can use any oil.  When the parsley has fully absorbed the oil, pour more oil on top, or put another piece of parchment over the top to keep it airtight.  Then let it sit on your kitchen counter.  You can make it last for a week or two this way.

suffix: Acne is a condition in which the skin cells at the base of hair follicles become clogged up with oils and dead skin cells. This can then result in an outbreak of tiny red pimples, called pimples or “zits”. Most skin on the body does not produce much oil, so acne is usually much more visible on the face.

Well, acne can be related to many factors, and not always the same ones. The most common factor that you hear about is bacteria, and the irritation that this causes. The pores in the skin can get clogged with dead skin cells, oil, and other gunk, and bacteria like to grow on that gunk. If the skin doesn’t shed the dead skin cells and dirt, the bacteria can cause inflammation, which causes the redness, and possibly pus, that you see when acne occurs.

suffix: I can do that, human!  The earliest recorded version of macaroni and cheese was made in Italy in 1769.  The dish, although not known by the name of macaroni and cheese, originated from the cheeses they were using.  During that time period it was common for people to eat pasta and cheese.

Macaroni and cheese comes from the idea of eating pasta, which was imported from Italy in the 1500s. In the 1880s, Pillsbury developed the recipe as an Americanized version of pasta, adding extra sauce to a box of pasta with a lot of cheese. Mac and cheese became popular because of the invention of the electric oven, which made it a lot easier to make a baked mac and cheese dish. By the early 1900s, it was a common food, with versions of the recipe by various companies, including Kraft, who released a special version for children called “Kraft Cheese n’ Macaroni”.
